title: Database Troubleshooting Guide
content: Steps: 1. Check connection pool stats 2. Verify network latency 3. Review recent schema changes

title: Auth Service Runbook
content: For connection issues, first check the database health dashboard

title: API Gateway Performance Tuning
content: Monitor memory usage, check for N+1 queries, review rate limiting settings

title: Payment Service Troubleshooting
content: Steps: 1. Check payment provider status page 2. Verify API credentials 3. Review transaction logs for error codes 4. Check network connectivity to payment gateway

title: Checkout Flow Runbook
content: For 500 errors in checkout, verify payment service health and check for timeout issues in upstream dependencies

title: Memory Leak Investigation Guide
content: Steps: 1. Capture heap dump 2. Analyze with VisualVM or MAT 3. Review recent code changes for unbounded caches or listeners 4. Check for connection leaks

title: Notification Service Architecture
content: Notification service uses template rendering that can be memory intensive. Monitor template cache size and consider pagination for large batches

title: SSL Certificate Management
content: Certificate renewal process: 1. Generate CSR 2. Submit to CA 3. Install new cert 4. Update load balancer 5. Verify with SSL Labs test

title: Security Incident Response
content: For certificate expiration warnings, escalate to security team immediately. Automated alerts should trigger 30 days before expiration

title: Kubernetes Node Failure Runbook
content: Steps: 1. Cordon failed node 2. Drain remaining pods 3. Investigate node health 4. Replace if hardware failure 5. Uncordon after recovery

title: Pod Eviction Troubleshooting
content: When pods are evicted, check node resource usage, DaemonSet status, and review kubelet logs for eviction reasons

title: Redis Cluster Operations
content: For connection failures: 1. Check Redis Sentinel status 2. Verify network policies 3. Review connection pool configuration 4. Check for memory pressure

title: Session Management Architecture
content: Sessions are stored in Redis with 24h TTL. Connection failures cause session lookup failures leading to user re-authentication

title: Elasticsearch Performance Guide
content: For indexing delays: 1. Check cluster health 2. Review bulk indexing settings 3. Monitor JVM heap usage 4. Check for mapping explosions

title: Search Service SLA Requirements
content: Search results should be indexed within 5 minutes. Delays beyond 15 minutes trigger critical alerts

title: CDN Cache Management
content: Cache invalidation steps: 1. Use API to purge specific paths 2. For full invalidation, use wildcard purge 3. Verify propagation across edge nodes

title: OAuth Integration Troubleshooting
content: For third-party OAuth issues: 1. Check provider status 2. Verify client credentials 3. Review token expiration settings 4. Implement fallback authentication

title: Identity Service Architecture
content: OAuth tokens are cached locally with 5min TTL. External provider timeouts should trigger circuit breaker after 3 failures

title: Database Replication Guide
content: For replica lag: 1. Check write volume on primary 2. Review replica hardware specs 3. Analyze slow query log 4. Consider read/write splitting

title: Database Failover Procedures
content: If replica lag exceeds 60 seconds, consider routing read traffic back to primary until replica catches up

title: RabbitMQ Operations Guide
content: For queue backlog: 1. Scale consumer instances 2. Check consumer processing time 3. Review message TTL 4. Consider dead letter queue for failed messages

title: Order Processing SLA
content: Order messages should be processed within 30 seconds. Backlog exceeding 50k messages triggers automatic scaling

title: Container Registry Runbook
content: For registry issues: 1. Check storage backend 2. Verify authentication service 3. Review garbage collection logs 4. Check disk space

title: Logging Pipeline Architecture
content: Logs flow: App -> Fluentd -> Kafka -> Logstash -> Elasticsearch. Check each component for bottlenecks

title: Observability SLA Requirements
content: Log ingestion should not lag more than 5 minutes. Missing logs indicate potential pipeline issues

title: Rate Limiting Configuration Guide
content: Rate limits are configured per API tier. Changes require staged rollout: dev -> staging -> canary -> production
